intro: Rinorea kamerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of West Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
